website_summaries.verdict: At 32 inches wide, this is a great beginner board that includes all the accessories you need to get started.
pros: A reasonably priced all-in-one package that includes a reliable hand pump, a collapsible paddle, and a waterproof bag
The rigid, stable design makes it easy to keep your balance
cons: The included paddle is flimsy and prone to breaking

customer_reviews.title: Great board to SUP with my pup!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable, inflatable paddle board that I could stow away and easily inflate when I wanted it. I have rented inflatable paddle boards that are double the price of this, so I was pleasantly surprised to see what great quality this board has! It is sturdy when blown up and definitely big enough for me and my pup (plus it was easy for her to stay on). I love how it fits easily (with the pump) in the backpack which makes it convenient for throwing in the back of the car or in a closet at home. Would definitely recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Pozniak

customer_reviews.title: Awful customer service
customer_reviews.text: Product is okay. Tread is aggressive and hurts my sisters feet, but I don't have an issue with it. The problem is their customer service, it is horrific. All of the reviews that talk about how rude they are is 100% accurate. It's like the customer is a huge problem. If they could upgrade their customer service personnel they would be a better company.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL J.

customer_reviews.title: Glorified pool toy
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to get this product, have been SUP for couple of years on rentals. This board is a complete joke, saw another review when they compared it to a glorified pool toy and they are exactly right. You can tell as soon as you open the box it is complete junk. Don't waste your time, you pay for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: melissa cempella

customer_reviews.title: Great Board for beginners! Would buy another one!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first SUP board, and I’m very happy with it! The size of the board is perfect, great quality board, bag, paddle, the works... they definitely did an amazing job with this paddle board! Best Purchase Ever! The bag it comes with is comfortable and easy to carry, I must admit, I was worried about the size of the bag but they managed to make it big enough to the board and all your goodies. A lil side note tip: get an electric pump with the board that sets the proper psi. I would’ve spent an extra 1/2 hour pumping the thing my self. Huge time saver!
customer_reviews.author: Rogelio Mora

customer_reviews.title: Zero recomendable for stability
customer_reviews.text: They are the worst tables that I could buy, and that I really compared, zero stability as they mention in their description, has a bad design in its form, I was fooled by the measures and descriptions of the technical and visual sheet of the product, I had High expectations and I was very disappointed. Not only does it not work for yoga, but in general. It does not have stability, you will have to make a great effort to keep standing and the trip is not enjoyable, it is not to brag but I have a good level in standing oar and the ride is not enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: alejandra rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the way the board feels, the weight (easy to carry) but the Non-slip traction pad literally started to come apart after one week. The bag you receive also started to fray. Super disappointed. Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: John Caldarella

customer_reviews.title: Unethical!
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviews, pump PSI does not work, and it’s pretty cheap. I’ve been looking at this for a few weeks now and the price was around $349 until the company decided to capitalize on Prime day raising price to $374 and right back down to $349 after prime day. Haven’t tried it on the water yet to see if this was worth the extra $25 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of these things is not like the others
customer_reviews.text: 4 of these boards are the same, the 10 ft 32 inch wide pretty, light weight, reasonably priced board. The other one is a 9 ft board. I am 6'1" and usually weigh 190+ pounds. The smaller board won't work for me. I bought the green one and it is great, maneuverable, and stable. I bought the grayish one and had to return it. Just be careful which one you order because the descriptions are all the same but the boards aren't.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Pick another brand... seal broke!
customer_reviews.text: We used this board with the given pump and made sure to inflate to the exact PSI. I am type A personality, made sure everything was done to directions. After it’s third use the paddle board was leaking air from the seal around the plug. What a bummer to know $350 wasn’t worth more than 3 uses. Purchase a different brand if comparing this one to others. Hope this helps someone!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Won't inflate
customer_reviews.text: it sounds like I'm having a problem a lot of other people had with the pump not connecting to the paddle board. Could not get it inflated. I kind of can't believe that this is an ongoing issue that isn't resolved. I'm returning it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy, affordable paddle board for learning!
customer_reviews.text: I got this paddle board to paddle along with my dad on the river and ocean, and it works just great! On the river, it’s much more stable obviously, inflates in about 10 minutes, and is VERY easy to carry. The ocean makes it a little more unstable due to the waves, but I’ve been able to surf a couple of whitewater waves into shore with it nonetheless! This paddle board is perfect for beginners and experienced paddleboarders alike, the surface is comfortable to sit, kneel, or stand on for upwards of an hour. Stays inflated well, and very easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Heather A. Passmore

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Went out for my first paddle boarding adventure with the Roc iSup. Set up was easy, but there was hesitation in trusting the electric pump. Soon after the first round on the water, I felt that we should check pressure with the manual pump. Once properly inflated (after user error), the second trip on the water was much more enjoyable. This is a complete package for those just getting started. The board is high quality and the “freebies” make the value even better. This is a great set up for a first timer too. I would highly recommend this product. ***I was not given any incentive for this product review***
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Harper

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My board came delivered with everything you need to have fun on the water and it was affordable! I know others who have ordered this brand and have been super happy so I chose to go the same route. The board looks great, great quality. I have not used it yet as it is winter here in PA, but I just ordered a second board for my daughter for her birthday and we are ready to get out on the water as soon as the weather breaks! I will be sure to provide any updates on the board after we use it!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal L. Baksis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, stable, easy up/down
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier. Super stable even with a nervous dog walking back and forth between my legs. Easy up easy down. Backpack and accessories it came with were fantastic! (My husband bought a more expensive set and it didn’t come with as nice of accessories) we used these boards to camp out on a lake.. barged our items (tent cooler, chairs everything) across the lake on top of the board and it was still super stable and sturdy. Would buy this over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniek

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: It was great first two months and today pumped it up to dis over a leak Company does not honor warranty. We have two and go in lakes only. One developed a leak on the side right in the middle where the crease is when you roll it up. Looks like more holes are forming. They will not replace and. Claim normal wear and tear. Just after two months of use? We didn’t even go out every day of the week. If this is normal after just two months they obviously aren’t made very well... not worth the $600 I spent. Nothing but junk. Top part is already peeling off. Spend your money elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: N.T. Hikergal42

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I took my iSUP out with my 83lb dog yesterday- first time paddle boarding for both of us. I fully expected to fall of a few times but didn't, even with my dog shifting her weight around. The board was quite stable and handled the lake chop from 20mph winds and boat wakes really well. I was able to sit/kneel comfortably to allow my dog to jump off into the water to swim and when it was time to pull her back up onto the board, we didn't tip over. The board was pretty maneuverable, tracked well, and moved plenty fast through the water. I'm very satisfied with my purchase and look forward to future outings!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Paddle sank to the bottom of lake
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited about this board. Took it camping for its first use. Had gone out on the lake a few times with no problems. Then a friend took it out and dropped the paddle in the water. It didn’t land flat, but upright and it filled with water and sank to the bottom of the lake. So the paddle only floats if it lands flat in the water. Love the board itself but giving a low rating because the paddle does not actually float. Super bummed about this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Durable, and Steady
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate, durable, and steady on the water - this has been a great device so far. Despite not having instructions, all the parts fit easily and it didn't take much time to inflate it. Everyone in our family, including my 8-year-old son and my 55 year old husband are enjoying it. We'll definitely stick with this brand when we buy our second paddle board.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The board seems like it's great quality. I haven't had the chance to use it yet, because it's winter, but I've been it up in my house and it seems awesome. My board originally came with a defective psi gauge on the pump. I registered my board and contacted customer service. It took them several days to respond, but they shipped me out two extra gauges to make sure I was up and running. They have can extremely helpful. I'm very pleased with the customer service. Can't wait to try it my board when it warms up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Lotz

customer_reviews.title: Thought I hit a jackpot
customer_reviews.text: I thought I got a high quality inflatable for a good price supported by good reviews but I was wrong. After receiving the item and inflating to check, noticed that the construction not nicely done. Pump is not like others which has double chamber making it difficult for others. Backpack is not good. By the look, it could easily be damaged or torn. It is only now that I fully read some reviews and it seems that the price is around 300 - 400 before the pandemic. Not like other vendor, the price almost doubled. During my purchase the price is 600. Definitely, this is going back.
customer_reviews.author: buhaghag

customer_reviews.title: Two versions - Explorer is best
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two paddle boards and decided to choose two different color designs. We learned the boards with multiple colors are different than the one-color boards. They are smaller, slower, lighter and less stable but they are sold on the same page and priced the same. My recommendation is to order the one-color boards. ROC calls it the Explorer model. The smaller boards are the Scout model. I love both boards and have used them 10+ times on a large lake with lots of traffic. If given a choice though I would go with the Explorer. I would order these again, but there are comparable boards out there, and would also consider price and specs.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddleboard!  Nice and Firm!
customer_reviews.text: I love this paddle board!!! It very easy to transport. I love going out on the lake using my paddleboard. When pumped up it is nice a firm and pretty stable. Like any paddleboard it does take some practice. But I know it will also improve my balance/coordination and work my core :) Just a tip - only go out when winds are 10 mph or less. Wind gusts can make your body into a sail. If it gets too windy when you are out, you can switch to paddling on your knees.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: We took them to the Sea of Cortez in Mexico and they were great. I can't speak to longevity yet but they look very durable and they were perfect. They held firm with air for the days we were there and they were great on the water. I recommend them. They'd be a 5 anyway but we lent the boards to a few friends and they broke the removable fin underneath (caveat: be careful when you set them down if the fin is in. Put them top down until your in water deep enough to take the fin). We emailed and asked how we could buy a new one and they replaced it free of charge!! Great product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Colin D.

customer_reviews.title: A great way into a great sport
customer_reviews.text: I'm not 100% if I love ROC or SUP'ing. But, this ROC board has definitely made SUP'ing a highlight of my week. I've been using this for over a month now. I've used it for just relaxing. I've paddled out and eaten lunch. I've even paddled out, and used it for crabbing (and have even caught some). I purchased this at the same time as a less expensive SUP. The ROC: * Has a better paddle * Has a better main fin * Has a better small fins * Has nicer accessories (pump, d-rings, backpack, etc) They've been communicative and responsive on social media when I've pinged them about something. Overall, I'm quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Phillabaum

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.text: I’ve rented boards a handful of times. After searching the internet for hours I finally decided on the ROC. I couldn’t be happier. I’ve taken it out 4 times in the first week. It does take about 10 to 15 minutes to fully inflate. Reasonably priced board for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Nead

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SUP at a reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: After researching both inflatable and hard SUPs I decided that an inflatable SUP would provide me with the most versatility. I purchased the Roc SUP based on reviews, affordability, and accessories and couldn’t be happier with my purchase. The Roc SUP is well constructed and is easily transported either on a roof rack or by deflating it and throwing it in the trunk. The SUP rides high in the water and is extremely stable. So stable in fact I was able to stand just minutes after putting it in the water. Whether you are looking for a SUP for exercise or leisure the Roc SUP will provide you with hours of enjoyment at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy to say that this is a great paddle board. I was worried it might be too big for my 5'0 stature, but I was wrong. It is very easy to carry around in the back pack, easy to inflate with the pump provided and easy to maneuver on the water. I am able to take it out without any assistance. It is also thick and wide enough for my Yorkshire terrier to join me, I am not worried about her nails breaking through at all. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: S McFarlane

customer_reviews.title: Nice Inflatable SUP
customer_reviews.text: This is a good inflatable SUP for the price point. The quality is good and the SUP holds up to branches and rocks well. The bag opens all the way so its easy to put the folded SUP back into the bag. The paddle and leash are good quality. The hand pump is okay but I would not rely on it as the sole pump. I use an electric pump anyway then finish it off with the hand pump to get to around 10 PSI. The stability of the SUP is good. The waterproof bag that it comes with is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great board!
customer_reviews.text: Great, great board! My 9 year old was using this within five minutes of it hitting the water and was able to stabilize herself and paddle around the lake. We didn’t buy it for her, but apparently we need to order another now :) It feels sturdy is well balanced and easy to inflate, would definitely order more for next season! Packs away easily and nicely when done. Have used it four times over the past month and every time I’m even more impressed. We ended up buying a second more expensive board that is rated to carry more weight but the truth is I like this one better than the more expensive one we bought.
customer_reviews.author: Pedsdoc

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS STURDY LARGE ECONOMICAL EASY TO MANEUVER
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of having inflatable- not too heavy to carry. They are sturdy, hold their air, wide and 6” deep which is crucial. Paddles are tall and adjustable. Back pack heavy duty. My adult children had two folks on them with a weight of close to 350 between them and no issues with stability at all. We absolutely love them and highly recommend. Best of all was customer service from ROC. we misplaced one of the large fine- totally our fault. Within a day over Christmas holidays someone from the company answered my email and offered to send replacement free of charge. Really great service.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy  Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Good Board, but buy your own paddle
customer_reviews.text: The board itself is nice. There were a number of paint spots that look different from the rest of the board. I really hope I did not receive a return that was just patched up, I guess time will tell. The reason for my low rating is the paddle. It is absolute junk. Even when tightened down, the handle rotates, making it impossible to use. This was an expensive board and I would hope that the paddle is at least useable, but it is not. Now I have to go spend another ~$75 for a paddle, and I cannot use it yet. Very frustrating. Besides that, the rest of the kit was great!
customer_reviews.author: Milton Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: Used 2x, started falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Overall 1 star. I was so excited to get one of the top rated SUPs available and everything was great the first time I used it!! That changed on the 2nd use... The carrying handle on the board started pulling out and was unattaching from the board. And the matting was peeling up around the edges. So disappointed because for $500 one expects MUCH higher quality craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality SUP
customer_reviews.text: After much online review, I decided on the ROC stand up paddle board and I couldn’t be more pleased with the quality. My boyfriend and I are even able to paddle together on it because this board has a 350 pound weight limit which is higher than most other boards I saw. Despite this board being inflatable, it feels just like a fiberglass board in the water. It Inflates quickly and easily and is relatively light weight making it much easier to carry that fiberglass SUP boards.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for but we all know that
customer_reviews.text: It’s an entry level SUP so for the price point I don’t expect the world but I have two complaints: 1st, the board I received doesn’t look like the board in the picture. I ordered a black board and the pictures show the sides black and the board that was delivered to me has white sides. 2nd, the adhesive or vinyl welding (not sure how it’s constructed) shows through the outer layer. I’m not too concerned about the structural integrity but it’s a cosmetic flaw for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wojcik

customer_reviews.title: Well worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome inflatable paddle board. It was very easy to blow up with the pump provided (only takes about 10 minutes). Once it’s blown up, it’s hard to tell that it’s an inflatable because the material is strong and durable. On the water it is very stable. I’ve taken it out on the lake several times and have had wonderful results each time. I also love the bag that they provide to carry the paddle board and all it’s equipment. It has heavy duty backpack straps that makes it easy to transport. Also, deflating and rolling it up doesn’t take long and is very easy. I would highly recommend this board.
customer_reviews.author: Rhodes family

customer_reviews.title: Great SUP ....  except for the pump hose connection
customer_reviews.text: This is a great SUP ! I had a great time with it. Very durable - comparable to my friend's SUP which cost ~3x !!!! The only issue is that I can't get the pump hose to seal properly against the port on the board. It constantly leaks while filling and requires someone to press down firmly while another is pumping in order to get to inflate to the 12-15 psig. Would be 5-star if the pump seal was better.....
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: High quality, ingenious design!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the quality of the materials and the ingenious collapsing design. It folds up into a very manageable size for one person to carry. I also appreciate the bag. Finally, a bag that has extra room in it!!! Seems like most products come with a bag that barely fits the contents, but only if you get it loaded exactly right! I also recommend adding the electric pump accessory. That will save a lot of time and energy... both of which you can use for more enjoyment on the water!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Achilles

customer_reviews.title: Still ice on the lakes but very happy with opening and setting it up. Great build/material quality!
customer_reviews.text: The only negative was that it takes about 300 pumps on the air pump to inflate. Other than that the bag is great, the paddles and equipment are great and the board feels strong and durable. I will be doing some still water/ lake paddle boarding, spearfishing and snorkeling off this as it will fit into the backpack (lighter than I thought with everything in it) I will keep it in my car for quick excursions. I thought about this for about two years and I am very impressed and happy I got it because It is built very, very well. Best board and bag set up deal on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Surrell

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these boards. I've been on lakes and rivers with them. The quality is very sturdy and even withstood class one rapids with lava rocks. I love how easy and quickly this SUP can be inflated and how portable it is. I will add two more , so that all 4 of us in our family can enjoy this amazing SUP. In addition to the great quality for a very reasonable price, I would like to point out that the customer service is amazing. I lost a fin and contacted the ROC customer service team. They got back immediately and sent me a replacement fin at no cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle-Kunde

customer_reviews.title: USA family owned company
customer_reviews.text: I really like a rigid traditional paddle board but couldn't get one here in Alaska without loosing and arm or leg to shipping. I did a ton of research and went with ROC because they're proud of being a USA company, shipping was free and, as it turns out, they really support their product. It is an inflatable and my feet are 4 inches above the water. So it took me a couple of times out to get use to the ride. However, the board is solid, light, and with it's accessories, super easy to pack in and out of remote lakes or travel with. I'm really enjoying this board and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Salyer

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner package
customer_reviews.text: This is my first summer owning my own paddle board (rented in the past). I have a rigid board, but it was difficult to transport by myself, so I wanted an inflatable. We have since purchased two more inflatables for the kids. This one is my favorite of the three though. It feels stable and is easy for me to get out of the car, inflate and get on the lake in about 10 minutes. I'm not sure how well it will hold up over time, but it was a good purchase this summer to get me out of the house and enjoying the outdoors, while still away from large groups of people!
customer_reviews.author: G. StJohn

customer_reviews.title: Great for the lake!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Portable - good looking - grip for me and the doggo- comes with paddle and dry bag- easy to assemble! Cons- takes a tiny workout to pump up (10 minutes of work - expect to sweat) If you had a automatic pump that would be the best situation. But honestly - who doesn't need a tiny workout with this quarantine 15. I would recommend this board to a friend. They have been a great addition to our outdoor activities and will cut down on rental costs in the long run! The colors are great and we were able to stay out on the lake all day with them without them loosing their stability/air.
customer_reviews.author: TGRIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Paddle Board
customer_reviews.text: Got this paddle board after lots of research! It’s my first one so I wanted something that would last but also be in my budget. This SUP is fantastic! It’s sturdy and pretty- I love the design. The paddle floats and the backpack is really well made. Nice padded straps for shoulders and hips. I can air it up in ten minutes and it deflates super Fast then rolls right up. Everything fits easily into the bag and is a manageable weight. Definitely would buy a board from this company again if I ever needed to. It was worth the extra money that I spent. Super happy with my ROC purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jolee Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before buying this particular stand up paddleboard. Now that I've used it several times, both in rivers and in lakes, I can write with certainty that I highly recommend it. I'm pleased with the quality and durability. It's super sturdy for being as light as it is. The large center fin was easy to take off when I was on a little white water in the river and put back on the next day while at the lake. I like having the portability of the backpack. The dry bag is a bonus! I recommended this SUP to a couple of friends and they are also each happy with theirs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Easy to Inflate and Packs Away Easily
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the Roc Inflatable Stand Up Paddleboard for a summer full of staying local on the lake. I'm pleased with the quality and portability of the ROC paddle board. It's big enough for 2 people and very sturdy. We've used it around 5 times now and it still looks great. It inflates in less than 10 minutes and it's easy to clean and pack away. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. Fearn

customer_reviews.title: Great board
customer_reviews.text: I tried a paddleboard for the first time on vacation and fell in love with it. When I got home, all I could find were inflatable boards and not a solid board. I was afraid of getting the inflatable for fear it wouldn't stay as firm as a fiberglass board. I'm glad I took the chance and got this. It takes about 15 minutes to inflate. Very firm and stable. Easy to maneuver. The bag is easy to wear as a backpack to the beach as well. I would highly recommend this to any new beginner. Perfect to throw in the trunk for a day playing on the lake.
customer_reviews.author: JSP

customer_reviews.title: Review of ROC SUP
customer_reviews.text: I did my research on inflatable SUP. This board kept coming up in my search and I loved that it was made in the USA. Overall, I am happy with my purchase. I love the ease and mobility of the board and paddle. It does take about 15 minutes to inflate, and a few minutes to put paddle together and add the fin. Once on the water, it is stable. I have used it in on lakes and rivers in WI. Easy to deflate and store in my SUV. I haven't' used the portable bag yet to get to a location. I am petite and I do wish bag had wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Sobieski

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these last fall and are fully satisfied with them. A little difficult to inflate the first time but much easier with an inexpensive electric pump. They have been left out all last fall and all summer so fart this year with no appreciable wear showing. This past weekend, one of them was left leaning against a large dock nail (spike) we use to tie the kayaks and paddle boards up with and I noticed my 12 year old standing on the boar. I was amazed that the board wasn't damaged or show any signs of abuse. So far these board are delivering everything as promised and more.
customer_reviews.author: Christian D'Alessandro

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: I used to rent a regular paddle board once a month and then the pandemic came. I live in front of a canal in Florida and every day I would see someone passing by paddle boarding and I decided it was about time to buy myself one. I wasn't sure I would adapt well in an inflatable one. Truth be told: there's hardly any difference. I love my board. I take it out once or twice a weekend and paddle very long distances. It's soft of the soles of my feet, stable, easy to inflate/carry/load... I love my board and wish I had bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this sup!!!
customer_reviews.text: Here's what you need to know: Everything you need comes with it. It's easy to blow up---I'm a short, middle-aged woman and have no problems airing it up. The board is very light-weight once fully inflated and VERY easy to put in and take out of the water. Storing it and carrying it in our RV is so convenient since everything goes into the backpack. The customer service is AWESOME!!!! I needed to replace the center fin after an unfortunate lake accident and they sent me a new one for free!!! How great is that?!? I'm so glad I chose this board and this brand! I look forward to many happy days on the water with it.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Solid Inflatable board
customer_reviews.text: This was our first paddle board and we weren't sure what to expect. Out of the package we were happy with the quality and all of the accessories included. It was very easy to set up but I needed a hand inflating it. Not really the fault of the product, I just didn't have the muscles to keep pumping for long. We did have an issue with the hose on the pump and I e-mailed customer service and they resolved it right away even though it was on a weekend. They are shipping me a new hose. The grand kids took it for a spin today and it worked great so I just ordered another one!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M

customer_reviews.title: leaks after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: have had less than a year. Used less than 10 times and it is leaking at a seam. Bought an electric pump that does not even inflate past 14psi. Follow all directions, ensuring I do not over inflate if in direct sun. Disappointing, while not the most expensive...I would have hoped to get more than that many uses out if it before it decided to break.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: So impressed. 5-Stars across the board! (get it? board...hehe)
customer_reviews.text: So much more stable and durable than I expected for an inflatable. This thing is rock solid. Inflates in about 10 minutes, and folds up and packs into the (awesome) backpack that they give you for free in about 5 minutes. My only complaint is the stock paddle that they give you is just a few inches shorter than I would need (I'm 6'2") so I had to get a new longer one. I've taken it in the SF Bay, Lake Tahoe, Truckee River, and Santa Barbara beaches. Never had a single issue with it. Can't recommend more highly!
customer_reviews.author: Cougar Oswald

customer_reviews.title: Please with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these boards to use on a local lake. The board itself is easy to inflate and feels solid when properly inflated. We have minimal experience on stand up paddle boards, but find these stable and easy to use even for a beginner. The only opportunity I have on these are their instructions provided are not very clear. I had to get with their customer service on some questions, but they were very responsive. I viewed some YouTube videos to get great pointers on deflating and packing up the board after use. This board is easy to transport deflated, inflate on site, use, then deflate and transport home. We are very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Life changing if you live near water
customer_reviews.text: I live a few blocks from a boat launch and thought I'd get one of these. Now I can grab it and walk down there and hop on and be out on the water in no time. It's really an incredible improvement in quality of life. It's surprisingly rigid for being inflatable (think: car tire rigid) and is relatively easy to get used to using. Now I go out whenever I can and get a workout while seeing all the things going on on the water, from birds to houseboats to drydocks to museums. Superlove it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick T

customer_reviews.title: Great board, at the price we paid... You may pay more though.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using 3x per week on average for a couple of months. Holding up well. Attractive too. The price climbed steeply due to coronavirus, and there are other products that are pretty close it quality for cheeper but that could simply be that these prices are inflated (no pun intended) and those aren't. We paid in the low 200s.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin T Bingham

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.  Good for adults and kids!
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of the SUP. I’m new to the hobby and researched a bunch of inflatables. I went with ROC because of the reviews and price and haven’t been disappointed. The product was as advertised and their customer service was responsive. When I first got the SUP the gauge of the pump didn’t work. I emailed customer service to let them know and a replacement was in the mail the next day. Very happy with the product and would recommend it to newcomers like me who want to get in the sport but don’t want to break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design. I though an inflatable SUP could never be as rigid as a "real" one but this one, inflated to 15PSI as indicated is 100% rigid enough for the intended use. As soon as you step on it, you forget it is inflatable. The carrying bag is great too. One downside is that the paddle will sink is you drop it in the water. This is not ideal. The manual pump bundled with the SUP is functional but be prepared for a workout. I bough an electric pump. The SUP seems to be durable too
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gorner

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Our boards arrived on time and were easy to inflate. We bought 2 and it took 6-8 minutes to inflate each of them. Our only complaint is that one on our maiden cigar of our paddles sunk when my husband took a spill. That is the reason for the 4 star rating. I would expect that the paddle would have floated as the other one does.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mazzucotelli

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable or durable
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited about this SUP board, but have had many issues after only a couple uses. The board does not keep air and the back fin fell off on the 2nd use. Not sure if I got one with defects or this is normal. Will contact the MFR and update review.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a day on the open ocean!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little reluctant at first to purchase an inflatable SUP, but I love it!!! It is very study, easy to inflate (much faster than I thought it would be), and packs up nicely for storage in a closet. My wife and I each bought one and we are happy with our purchase. For beginner SUP users, it’s perfect. I felt comfortable on the open water. We love packing a cooler and spending the day at the beach and on the water. I definitely recommend. You can’t beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: HLAW

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended SUP
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this and have used it once. It seems very well made and durable from first use but I will update as the summer progresses. This is a big board and easily supports my 6’ 265 lb. The fins make the board very sturdy and it is easily maneuvered. The backpack carrying bag is a very good size and seems well made also. The hand pump inflates the board fairly quickly and has a pressure gauge to tell you when it is inflated which is helpful. Also, the company is very responsive and a pleasure to work with. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this paddleboard to take to Hawaii on vacation. There was plenty of room in the bag to pack lifejackets and other items. The cinch straps were effective for tightening the load. Upon arrival we headed to the beach. It took a bit longer to inflate than expected using the provided hand pump, but it was intuitive and we had no problems. This item provided hours of fun. After 10 days, the only signs of wear were some slight discoloration/scuff marks. The board is currently in St. Kitts with friends and will be taken to Bristol Bay, AK this spring/summer. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Leash and pump didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these, one of them seemed to be complete and everything worked fine, the other one was missing a piece from the leash and I was not able to connect it to the board. One of the pumps was also not working right, where it connected to the board seemed to not want to seal, though I was able to remedy this by using the other pump. My co-worker said I could get Amazon to send me the leash and pump but I could figure that out, so I will just put it in a review.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Everything great
customer_reviews.text: I bought two paddle boards and everything was great . They are easy to blow up, put away, and fit nicely in the travel backpack. Watch the fins to make sure they are securely snapped in, we did not snap them properly and I had to email ROC for the replacement. Our family says this is the best investment we have ever made
customer_reviews.author: Mary Steinke

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy & holds both my husband and me!
customer_reviews.text: This paddle board is super light weight. My boys had zero problems carrying it down to the water and back. It's comfortable on the knees, especially compared to other boards we've used in the past. It was easy to inflate and deflate and great for traveling. Also, it carried both my husband and me with no signs of problems and we're well above the weight limit listed when together. Very pleased with our purchase! Would definitely recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one for my husband as it held more weight (for when the dog comes with!) I got the SereneLife one and we are very impressed with both. We liked the ROC has a little more "storage" capacity and came with a waterproof bag, where the SereneLife came with a double ended pump to pump & let out air. So we got the best of both worlds getting all of that! Cannot wait to get them out in the water in CO!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Payne

customer_reviews.title: Love this board!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one a month ago and have used it 3x on lakes and rivers near me. I am a beginner in stand up paddleboarding but this board made it easy for my family to learn the basics. Very stable, light, and easy to unpack and pack after use. My small complaint that it takes some elbow grease to pump the board, but I assume most inflatables require the same effort. My kids loved it for just hanging out on the lake and my wife loves the workout it provides. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Bull Trader

customer_reviews.title: The pump sucks!!
customer_reviews.text: This paddle board was pretty awesome to travel With. The only problem I have is that the pump didn’t work properly. The PSI gage didn’t work at all which made it Diffuculf to inflate properly. It also has a special attachment so you can’t use any pump to inflate. So not having it inflated properly made it unstable and difficult to stand on. Other than that it was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Leroux

customer_reviews.title: Best $600 I’ve spent in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Love this board! I did my research on multiple Google searches and this board came up on every list. I think it’s safe to say the Amazon reviews reflect how well liked this board is. I thought my pump gage was broken, but after reading other reviews, you really have to inflate it in order for it to start reading the pounds. Don’t give up! Bonus, it comes with a small waterproof bag, a lifesaver for phone, keys, a snack, and sunscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome board! This is my first ever SUP and I absolutely love it! I've taken it out a couple of times already and havent had any issues with it. The inflation process takes close to 10 minutes with the hand pump but I look at it as a nice workout! I reached out to Roc customer support for a few minor questions, like was I pumping up the board correctly because I wasn't sure if I was going to pop it, and they were very pleasant and quick with their responses and didn't make me feel as though I was an inconvenience to them. I highly recommend this board!!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Cozzetto

customer_reviews.title: Great buy except backpack
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this purchase! My husband and I absolutely love it and will be purchasing a second one. Very easy to use, set up clean and deflate. The only disappointment was the backpack after a month it started to rip along the seam its ripped about 3 inches right now I can still use it and need to get patched somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Savanna Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: SUP is great, the carrying bag is very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We like the SUPs very much but one of the nicest discoveries is how comfortable the carrying bags are. We like to carry the SUPs into lakes in the mountains, sometimes hiking for a few hours. The bags are very comfortable to carry. The only advice I have is not to stuff the bags too full. I have a habit of stuffing everything I can into the bags and it puts too much strain on the bag linings. I have had to reinforce a couple of the seams.
customer_reviews.author: dallen

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Cost-friendly board.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this board. I’ve been paddle-boarding recreationally for a few years, and this budget friendly board ABSOLUTELY holds it’s own when compared to the $1000+ boards I’ve tried before. It’s stable, compact, and comes with everything you need to get started. When I started looking at boards (after getting tired of renting/mooching off friends/family) I was incredibly intimidated by price. I was worried I was going to waste a ton of money on a board I was going to hate. Once I got this board and assembled it, I knew there were going to be no regrets and I got it at a price point that didn’t make me have to eat ramen until next pay-day.
customer_reviews.author: Cicily Webb

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after one use. Would like refund.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once. Missed my return window or else I would have returned it. Leaks like crazy around the valve. Unable to trouble shoot. Not willing to buy a replacement part as it is BRAND NEW. Do not spend money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great SUP!
customer_reviews.text: I love my ROC SUP!! It’s lightweight, easy to transport, stable and super fun. Like most inflatable boards, pumping it up to the recommended PSI is a bit of a workout in itself, but only takes about 10 minutes. I live that I can load, assemble and pack up without needing assistance from anyone. Highly satisfied. Also, the ROC customer service is great. After 5-6 uses, the non slip padding on my board began to lift (which is not a typical problem experienced with this brand). I emailed them and the company sent me a brand new replacement board super fast with paid shipping to return my board.
customer_reviews.author: MrFister

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for an inflatable SUP!
customer_reviews.text: I love this inflatable SUP! I have been out on it on the ocean in CA (cruising, not surfing) and on the river in OR and it is stable, easy to steer, moves along and is comfortable and big enough for me and my dog - or a paddler and a loafer sitting on the front. It takes some muscle to inflate to the required PSI, but it is doable by one person and easier with two trading off pumping. It packs nicely and easily into the backpack that comes with (including paddle and pump). The inflated board is light and easy to carry, and so is the full backpack. I recommend this SUP!
customer_reviews.author: Anthea Beletsis

customer_reviews.title: Comes with all you need!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board package couple of days ago and took out for an easy paddling. Yay! I am so happy to have found a reasonable price good quality SUP board! It comes with everything one needs, and includes a bag to carry all in. I live close to waterfront and carried about 5 minutes using the holder, and it worked out pretty fine. Easy to carry, weight was fine, not heavy as hard boards. Highly recommend this board! It is pretty stable on the water. I love the dry bag came with the board too. When I bought only black was available. I just noticed now that other colors are available, too :)
customer_reviews.author: z

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roc
customer_reviews.text: This may just be the best thing I have ever purchased through Amazon. I was skeptical about getting an inflatable paddle board after years of using a hard one - but the durability and stability of the Roc board leaves nothing to be desired. When fully inflated it is sturdy enough for me, a dude who stands at 6’7”. If you’re looking for a quality paddle board that comes with a neat assortment of goodies and is easy to get from place to place - this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Unboxed & Inflated
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy for me to inflate (about 10 min) my husband inflated his in half my time or less lol. Very impressed so far with the kit and loving all the accessories. The carry backpacks are no joke- reminds me of my hiking backpack. Hint: when unpacking the air pump look for a loose o-ring in the bag! You need to swap out the one on the end of the pump with this thinner one so it locks around the SUP air valve correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Darcy approves!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously best purchase I have made lately. With things being insane during this pandemic being able to get out on the lake is truly my one moment of peace! I was skeptical of inflatable boards but I can not even tell a difference. I was able to easily maneuver it even with my skipper (pup) moving around. Neither of us ended up in the water so I call that a success. One recommendation - invest in an electric pump! It is so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Accessories & Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I did not get to try out the board yet but I can't wait to get it on the water. The accessories and backpack are pretty awesome. The accessories and SUP board fit into the backpack with ease and the backpack is super comfortable on my back. I can't wait till it gets warmer out and I can try out the board. Once I do, I will rate the durability and sturdiness. If it is as good as the accessories and the backpack, I will be very happy!
customer_reviews.author: William Rickert

customer_reviews.title: Great paddleboard!
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate how comprehensive the package is for this paddleboard. The board, fin, paddle, leash, dry bag, pump, backpack, etc. were all in the package. The directions for setting up the board were very clear and easy to follow. It takes a good bit of work to pump up but not a long time (10-15 minutes) and seems to hold up for many uses. The board is really light, as well, which is a great advantage. It feels very solid and stable on the water. Great way to enjoy my neighborhood lake!
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy-to-use, great all-around
customer_reviews.text: This is my first board. I was looking for something that was reliable and I could use for many seasons. I also needed a stable board. I think I nailed it. The board is stable and a delight to use. I've used it almost every day this summer and can't get enough of it. Seems like an amazing purchase. My only recommendation is that you also get an automatic inflator with it, especially if you plan to use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Tzeitel Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: I got the iRoc board about 2 months ago for my birthday. I've only taken it out a few times, but I have to say I'm pretty happy with it. I have a rigid board already, but I wanted to get an inflatable as a backup board and for traveling. I'm glad I did. It's super portable, made of quality materials, and it actually looks really good. For the money, I don't see how you can go wrong. I would recommend getting an electric pump for it though. Getting up to 12+ psi by hand is a bit challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Cécile

customer_reviews.title: BEST BUY EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made. This board is perfect for beginners. Setup takes about 10 minutes and is an arm workout. Packing up takes less than 5. Everything easily fits into the backpack. Company has been great to work with. The orange padding has started to slightly lift on the edges so I am curious to see how long the product lasts but you can't get a better paddleboard for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Katie D

customer_reviews.title: It's the best water toy
customer_reviews.text: Love it waited for a year to get one. so glad I waited. because with all my research this was the best bang for my buck. I can carry it my self i am 56 and can do it .Love that it can fit in the backseat and how big the bag to carry the equipment in and holds more stuff like extra paddle and stuff.extremely happy.three girlfriends are buying them .it will really be fun when we all have them.my neighbor's already ordered hers Yahoo thank you for this great board. Ok off to the lake have a great day
customer_reviews.author: sherri

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use all the way around!
customer_reviews.text: We have used our ROC paddle boards on lakes only so far, no ocean yet. These boards are easy to inflate and then deflate and pack back up in their bags. They are super easy to carry because of their light weight. They are hard as a rigid board when inflated correctly. The problem is with the paddles they are great for adults who are not always in the water. The kids were playing and the paddle filled with water and one actually sank... bye bye! We actually just love them!
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great board but the nozzle had issues
customer_reviews.text: I love this board and once you have it inflated its amazing. I bought it for our summer beach vacation we take every year and I was impressed with its sturdiness and functionality. My only complaint is that the nozzle wouldn't lock in for inflation so we had to physically hold it down (a real pain in the butt) and kept loosing air everytime we had to start over but eventually we got it inflated. I've used others and the nozzle locked right in so inflating it is a work out but doable.
customer_reviews.author: mom of  Imogen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a regular sup and this inflatable sup. The regular one was too big to take on vacation, so I ordered the ROC. I tested the ROC in the lake and it worked fine. I took my two great nieces for a ride on the ROC and it was very stable. I deflated it and packed it back in the travel bag and Took it to Canada - eh. Nice to be able to SUP during our family vacation. I'd ordered another. It was easy for on over 60 year old to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: plum

customer_reviews.title: Good for this Newbie!
customer_reviews.text: Having a great time with my new paddle board. The bag you get is great but you have to really fold yours up to get it in there. The fin adds stability and helps you continue going straight. Everything seems to be good quality and works very well on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Alakai

customer_reviews.title: Great, lightweight board
customer_reviews.text: Great stand up board-easier to inflate than you would think! Very lightweight making it super easy to carry around and get in and out of the water. I love the adjustable paddle-it makes the board usable for even our ten year-old daughter. It took me a little bit to get to feeling stable on the board, but it is super easy to maneuver around the lake. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super stable and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Tried my Roc ISUP Scout our the other day, totally fell in love! I purchased an electric pump because it’s 113° and I have no desire to pass out before I get on the water. It inflated wonderfully, felt super stable on the water and I can’t wait to get out again! I do wish there were handles on the front and back so someone could have helped me walk it the half mile from the parking garage to the lake, but I’ll find some wheels for that I guess. Outside of that, it’s definitely a 5 star board!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cole

customer_reviews.title: So much fun on the water.
customer_reviews.text: After renting boards for a long time I decided to buy my own board. I did a ton of research, and chose this ROC board. It comes with everything you need, takes about 10 minutes to inflate and performs amazingly in the water. The bag is great and easy to transport. The board is nice and light after inflated and easy to carry around. The water proof bag of an awesome plus to store phone and keys while boarding. Will be purchasing another board for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: M B

customer_reviews.title: Great board, love the setup. Prob w/ Guage
customer_reviews.text: I finally got this out on the water today. It was easy to take along in the backpack, spread it out, inflated it etc. But I couldn't get the pressure Guage to read why pressure at all. First time out there want enough pressure so I added more and it was good. Am I doing something wrong? Or is the pump/ Guage not working properly. I had two other people check it out and we couldn't see what else to do.
customer_reviews.author: Randirae

customer_reviews.title: Great board
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to get on the water with it yet but the board is pretty nice. There are minor blemishes around the edge of the board that I noticed upon opening and inflating but nothing major. One problem I did run into while inflating the board was that the psi indicator doesn't work on my pump so I am not sure if I have too much or too little air inside of the board at any time. UPDATE: the PSI guage works I just needed a lot more pressure than I expected to make the needle start moving!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Steven Burns

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy board and amazing customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a ton of reviews and settled on the ROC, several reviews mentioned the great customer service. Like others, I didn't understand the gauge when inflating. I emailed ROC and got a very fast response (within a few hours) - I needed to keep inflating it even though it already looked fully inflated, because the gauge has a minimum pressure that I hadn't yet reached. Perfect! Super easy. Amazing customer service, friendly and fast. Best of all the board is super easy to use and can be left inflated. I've kept it inflated all summer and it's still perfect. Everyone loves it and I'll probably get a second one.
customer_reviews.author: gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: It took about 10 minutes to inflate and then I was good to go. I used it on the Willamette River in Lake Oswego, Oregon which due to all the boat traffic was probably not the best place for the inaugural use. I'm planning on hitting one of the calmer lakes before the summer is over. The fact that it all fits into a back pack is awesome. I knocked one star off for stability as inflatable SUP are inherently less stable.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Stone

customer_reviews.title: ROC'ing Paddlebaord
customer_reviews.text: I debated between getting a hard board or an inflatable one. After researching, my husband and I decided to give the ROC inflatable boards a try and we LOVE them. They are easy to transport and light enough to carry without exhausting us. They inflate fairly quickly with the pump provided and are very stable in the water. I even took my granddaughter out on the board with me and had no problems maneuvering in the water. I would HIGHLY recommend this board. I have nothing negative to say. We also get a lot of compliments from other people when out riding on them. I have already recommended this board to several of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Can't Get Enough Romance

customer_reviews.title: Such a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We loved the inflatable paddle board. I was worried it might not feel solid or stable, but it inflated so firmly you can't tell the difference to a hard board, for practical purposes. It's beautiful and fun. It's light and easy to carry even inflated, and transporting it in the box deflated is simple and convenient. We spent hours using it and after getting the hang of standing, the kids also would ride along with us (one parent at a time) and loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Glueck

product_meta.title: Roc Inflatable Stand Up Paddle Board W Free Premium SUP Accessories & Backpack, Non-Slip Deck. Bonus Waterproof Bag, Leash, Paddle and Hand Pump
feature_bullets: 🏄 End of Season Sale!! ROC Paddle Boards premium inflatable paddle board is made of the highest quality military grade material. We provide the most durable lightweight board on the market, using the same materials as boards costing twice as much.

🏄Our extra wide design creates an incredible all-around board for people of all skill level. These kits can be used in the ocean, fresh water lakes, and rivers. Our boards are an industry-leading weight of only 17.5 pounds—that’s 20% lighter than competitors’. Board dimensions are 10’ long by 32” wide and 6” thick with a weight limit of 300 pounds.

🏄Our premium paddle board package has everything you need to enjoy your day on the water including: your board, collapsible aluminum paddle, safety leash, hand pump, waterproof bag for essentials such as cell phone and keys, and an upgraded backpack to hold everything. Comfortable and convenient, this complete elite package will get you anywhere you want to paddle.

🏄 USA family owned company!! We stand by the quality of our boards and are glad to provide a 1 year manufacturer’s warranty at no additional cost. With tens of thousands of boards sold across the world, you can trust ROC as the leader in quality and fun!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
